meanings.definition: A projecting spout from which a fluid is discharged
meanings.sent1: The firefighter aimed the nozzle at the fire to spray water.
meanings.sent2: The nozzle on the watering can helped distribute water evenly in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The nozzle on the soda machine was so powerful, it sprayed soda everywhere!
meanings.sent4: Her words flowed out of her like water from a nozzle, unstoppable and direct.
meanings.sent5: The nozzle of the fountain created a beautiful arc of water in the park.

meanings.definition: A short tube with a taper or constriction used to control the flow of a fluid
meanings.sent1: He adjusted the nozzle on the hose to change the water pressure.
meanings.sent2: The nozzle on the spray bottle allowed for a fine mist to be sprayed.
meanings.sent3: The nozzle on the vacuum cleaner got clogged with dirt and needed cleaning.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a nozzle-like quality, soft and controlled.
meanings.sent5: The nozzle on the oil can was perfect for lubricating small parts.

meanings.definition: A small piece of equipment that is attached to the end of a hose or pipe to control the flow of a liquid or gas
meanings.sent1: The mechanic replaced the broken nozzle on the fuel pump.
meanings.sent2: She twisted the nozzle on the gas pump to start filling her car.
meanings.sent3: The nozzle on the air compressor made a funny noise when turned on.
meanings.sent4: His words came out in a steady stream, like a nozzle controlling the flow.
meanings.sent5: The nozzle on the garden sprayer helped him water the plants efficiently.
